column4: anyone give any advice on the ntfs-3g driver?   is it stable enough to use it to mount my home directories with something fstab like /dev/sda1 /home/ ntfs-3g defaults 0 0  ?
dont use ntfs-3g or ntfs for your home directory
i doubt if you find a work around for that. its just because the 2 filesstems are so different
o.k.  i guess i will have to live with it for now... thanks for the advice.... someday someone will make a portable filesystem
